Young chefs battle it out in salad contest By DAVID SHAROS Aurora Beacon-News March 29 2018 04 00 AM AURORA Ill. Four teams of students from area middle schools battled it out recently at the Prisco Community Center in Aurora during the sixth annual Kane County Top Healthy Chef Competition sponsored by Sodexo Food Service. Chefs from Waldo Jefferson and Fischer middle schools in Aurora and Bednarcik in Oswego had 30 minutes to make the healthiest salad possible from a surprise basket of ingredients which included avocado dragon fruit and rainbow carrots. The kids need to use the three ingredients as well as chose one bean â€“ black kidney or garbanzo beans explained Jim Pilmer executive director of the Fox Valley Park District who served as one of the judges. These kids are our future and learning to eat properly will affect their lives. Teams of four were joined by a consulting chef from Sodexo including Chef Michael Rehfeldt who works for the food service provider at George Williams College in Wisconsin and was part of the competition a year ago. You ve got all of these fresh veggies and lettuce and greens grown through hydroponics. Triple Threat Mentoring Director Sue Natiello brought a wall of hydroponic greens including various types of lettuce and also peppers grown at the group s indoor urban farm. We want to teach kids about growing food and empowering them she said. We grow these things without soil and all I can tell you is they taste more green. Rehfeldt said his role and that of other chefs supporting the teams would be to do prep work and chopping and to challenge teams on their ingredient choices. This isn t the dump and drop old-school salad but if kids want to use say a blood orange they need to go back and see what it tastes like and think if this or that ingredient would pair with it he said. Previous competitions have included making a sandwich pizza snack and breakfast. The theme for each event general manager for Sodexo Brandie Jevtik said is chosen by a Community in Schools committee. We have committee members from Kane County Aurora University Rush Copley (Medical Center) the Fox Valley Park District and Waubonsee Community College Jevtik said. There is a selection process for kids and some of them are very competitive and practice after school. Fischer Middle School student Dajah Vance 12 was one of the competitors who said she loves to cook. I have an older brother that cooks too and we both do it Vance explained. I ve made spaghetti and things like mac-and-cheese and it wasn t out of the box either. I ve cut up the cheese cubes and melted them with milk and cooked the noodles. Vance said the plan for her team s salad was to make it colorful and make sure things matched up well. Teammate Jeremiah Jackson 12 said he would not be the team leader but was happy to serve as a helper. I m not sure being in front of all of these people is comfortable but I want to learn something so I don t have to depend on my mom or some girl and I can cook for myself he said. For me if I want to have people over I want to know I can cook for them. Bednarcik Middle School student Nicholas Ramirez 12 said his selection on the team this year was also a matter of luck. I did this a year ago and it was fun and I wanted to do it again Ramirez explained. You had to sign up and fill out a form. The school wound up putting eight names in a hat and four of us were picked. Ramirez said he learned a few important lessons a year ago and promised to implement them this time around. You have to do a number of things at once and everyone needs a job he said. We didn t do that last year and so we didn t finish on time. The Beacon-News is a Chicago Tribune publication.
